channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Epstein Files: How Trump is trying to shift the spotlight to Clinton and the Democrats
This Week in Explainers: How suicide bomber killed 12 in Islamabad
History Today: How a nervous Nathuram Godse was executed for killing Gandhi
Tejashwi Yadav, Maithili Thakur and more... The big winners and losers in Bihar
Trump faces heat from lawmakers to release Epstein files: What’s next?
Nitish & Modi magic reigns, RJD's poor show and more... Big takeaways from the Bihar election results
Why Trump’s popularity in America is plunging even deeper
item.description: The ‘Trump effect’ has been divisive and unsettling to social structures and political cohesion in the US. There is growing concern among Americans about how Trump's presidency has intensified the political divide

item.title: Nine lessons from tsuNiMo in Bihar: Decoding a verdict that could reshape Bharat’s politics
item.description: Bihar’s verdict delivers a clear message: electoral success today hinges less on identity or optics and more on governance, trust, credible delivery, and disciplined organisation

item.title: Bihar elections prove Modi’s popularity in Hindi heartland, send global message
item.description: This decisive Bihar victory reinforces the NDA’s legitimacy and national standing

item.title: Khawaja Asif’s ‘two-front’ delusion: Why Pakistan keeps provoking Bharat — even after repeated defeats
item.description: The ‘Medina mindset’ makes Islamabad a perpetual adversary of Bharat, driven by the belief that simply retaining the ability to challenge New Delhi is itself victory

item.title: Delhi blast cautions India about internal-external terror nexus
item.description: For any nation, homegrown terrorism is amongst the most serious threats, especially if it is supported and backed by a foreign adversary

item.title: How President Murmu’s Botswana visit heralds a shared India-Africa future
item.description: As both countries prepare to celebrate 60 years of diplomatic ties in 2026, their collaboration is poised to evolve into a model of South-South partnership—one that combines India’s developmental experience and Botswana’s governance excellence
